analytic.title: How Much Time Remains to Hagar’s Sons? Two Sources on Early Christian-Muslim Relations and Some Notes on Them

biblStruct.note: The paper focuses on the first decades and centuries of Christian-Muslim relations, with emphasis on the Northern Mesopotamia. It also presents translations into Czech of two sources – the “Edessene Apocalypse” and short part of the “Zuqnīn Chronicle”. Using these historical texts as examples the author highlights both the apocalyptic mood in the society of the time and the issue of early conversions from Christianity to Islam.
